name: CancelBatchExportBackfill
description:
Cancel a batch export backfill process.

Use this tool to cancel an ongoing batch export backfill for a specific project and batch. It should be called when a backfill process needs to be halted.

parameters.name: batch_export_identifier
parameters.description: A unique identifier string for the batch export backfill to be canceled.

parameters.name: batch_export_backfill_id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying the specific batch export backfill to cancel.

value_schema.description: A UUID string identifying this batch export backfill.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The ID of the project to access. Call /api/projects/ to find the project ID.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: backfill_request_details
parameters.description: JSON object containing details about the backfill to be canceled, including id, progress, status, and timestamps.

start_at.description: The start of the data interval.

end_at.description: The end of the data interval.

status.description:
The status of this backfill.

* `Cancelled` - Cancelled
* `Completed` - Completed
* `ContinuedAsNew` - Continued As New
* `Failed` - Failed
* `FailedRetryable` - Failed Retryable
* `Terminated` - Terminated
* `TimedOut` - Timedout
* `Running` - Running
* `Starting` - Starting

created_at.description: The timestamp at which this BatchExportBackfill was created.

finished_at.description: The timestamp at which this BatchExportBackfill finished, successfully or not.

last_updated_at.description: The timestamp at which this BatchExportBackfill was last updated.

batch_export.description: The BatchExport this backfill belongs to.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.
